properties.areaDesc: Waters from South Santee River SC to Edisto Beach SC extending from 20 nm to 40 nm; Waters from Edisto Beach SC to Savannah GA extending from 20 nm to 40 nm; Coastal waters from Edisto Beach SC to Savannah GA out 20 nm; Coastal waters from South Santee River to Edisto Beach SC out 20 nm
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued February 13 at 5:33PM EST by NWS Charleston SC
properties.description:
At 533 PM EST, thunderstorms were located along a line extending from
Kiawah Reef to 7 nm south of Betsy Ross Reef, moving east at 50
knots.

HAZARD...Winds up to 30 knots.

IMPACT...Expect briefly stronger winds and suddenly higher waves.
Put on a personal flotation device.

Marine locations impacted through 630 PM EST include:
Joe Shuford Reef...               Y-73 Reef...
Edisto Buoy...                    Edisto Offshore Reef...
Capers Mid Shelf...               Charleston Sixty...
Doug Mellichamp Reef...           Lowcountry Anglers...
Comanche Reef...
properties.instruction:
Mariners can expect gusty winds to around 30 knots, locally higher
waves, lightning strikes, and poor visibility in heavy rain. Boaters
should seek safe harbor immediately until these storms pass.

NWSheadline: HAZARDOUS THUNDERSTORMS IMPACTING THE COASTAL WATERS
